triples.name: Network science
triples.relevance: The foundational framework for studying complex systems through network representations and graph theory.

triples.name: Complex system
triples.relevance: The primary application domain for higher-order network dynamics across social, biological, and technological systems.

triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: The mathematical structure underlying higher-order networks where edges can connect multiple nodes simultaneously.

triples.name: Synchronization
triples.relevance: A key dynamical process studied on higher-order networks involving coupled oscillators achieving collective behavior.

triples.name: Epidemic
triples.relevance: The model for studying contagion processes and spreading dynamics on networks of interacting individuals.

triples.name: Cooperation (evolution)
triples.relevance: The evolutionary concept underlying group interactions and cooperative dynamics studied in higher-order networks.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: A dynamical process where networked agents reach agreement through local interactions and information exchange.
